Chapter-7: Examining the Multilevel Model’s Error Covariance Structure

7.1 The “Standard” Specification of the Multilevel Model for Change

Table 7.1:

opposites_naming |>
  select(-time) |>
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = wave,
    values_from = opposites_naming_score,
    names_prefix = "opp_"
  ) |>
  relocate(baseline_cognitive_score, .after = everything()) |>
  head(10)
#> # A tibble: 10 × 6
#>    id    opp_1 opp_2 opp_3 opp_4 baseline_cognitive_score
#>    <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>                    <dbl>
#>  1 1       205   217   268   302                      137
#>  2 2       219   243   279   302                      123

Table 7.2, page 246:

mucog <- mean(opposites_naming$baseline_cognitive_score)

opposites_fit_A <- glmmTMB(
  opposites_naming_score ~
    time * I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog) + (time | id),
  data = opposites_naming,
  REML = TRUE
)

summary(opposites_fit_A)
#>  Family: gaussian  ( identity )
#> Formula:          opposites_naming_score ~ time * I(baseline_cognitive_score -  
#>     mucog) + (time | id)
#> Data: opposites_naming
#> 
#>      AIC      BIC   logLik deviance df.resid 
#>   1303.0   1326.6   -643.5   1287.0      136 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance  Std.Dev.  Corr 
#>  id       (Intercept) 9.001e+02 3.000e+01      
#>           time        5.781e-14 2.404e-07 0.99 
#>  Residual             3.313e+02 1.820e+01      
#> Number of obs: 140, groups:  id, 35
#> 
#> Dispersion estimate for gaussian family (sigma^2):  331 
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>                                          Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)
#> (Intercept)                              164.3743     5.6870  28.903  < 2e-16
#> time                                      26.9600     1.3759  19.595  < 2e-16
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)       -0.1136     0.4619  -0.246 0.805789
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)   0.4329     0.1117   3.874 0.000107
#>                                             
#> (Intercept)                              ***
#> time                                     ***
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)         
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog) ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

7.2 Using the Composite Model to Understand Assumptions about the Error Covariance Matrix

7.3 Postulating an Alternative Error Covariance Structure

Table 7.3, page 258-259:

Table 7.4, page 265:

summary(opposites_fit_A)
#>  Family: gaussian  ( identity )
#> Formula:          opposites_naming_score ~ time * I(baseline_cognitive_score -  
#>     mucog) + (time | id)
#> Data: opposites_naming
#> 
#>      AIC      BIC   logLik deviance df.resid 
#>   1303.0   1326.6   -643.5   1287.0      136 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>  Groups   Name        Variance  Std.Dev.  Corr 
#>  id       (Intercept) 9.001e+02 3.000e+01      
#>           time        5.781e-14 2.404e-07 0.99 
#>  Residual             3.313e+02 1.820e+01      
#> Number of obs: 140, groups:  id, 35
#> 
#> Dispersion estimate for gaussian family (sigma^2):  331 
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>                                          Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)
#> (Intercept)                              164.3743     5.6870  28.903  < 2e-16
#> time                                      26.9600     1.3759  19.595  < 2e-16
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)       -0.1136     0.4619  -0.246 0.805789
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)   0.4329     0.1117   3.874 0.000107
#>                                             
#> (Intercept)                              ***
#> time                                     ***
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)         
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog) ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

# Toeplitz
opposites_fit_B <- update(
  opposites_fit_A,
  . ~ . - (time | id) + toep(time + 0 | id),
  dispformula = ~ 0
)

summary(opposites_fit_B)
#>  Family: gaussian  ( identity )
#> Formula:          opposites_naming_score ~ time + I(baseline_cognitive_score -  
#>     mucog) + (toep(time + 0 | id)) + time:I(baseline_cognitive_score -  
#>     mucog)
#> Dispersion:                              ~0
#> Data: opposites_naming
#> 
#>           AIC           BIC        logLik      deviance      df.resid 
#>  5.013983e+12  5.013983e+12 -2.506992e+12  5.013983e+12           139 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>  Groups Name Variance Std.Dev. Corr
#>  id     time 9.985    3.16         
#> Number of obs: 140, groups:  id, 35
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>                                            Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)
#> (Intercept)                               1.644e+02  1.726e-05 9521576   <2e-16
#> time                                      2.696e+01  5.341e-01      50   <2e-16
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)      -1.136e-01  1.402e-06  -80993   <2e-16
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)  4.329e-01  4.338e-02      10   <2e-16
#>                                             
#> (Intercept)                              ***
#> time                                     ***
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)      ***
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog) ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

# Unstructured
opposites_fit_C <- update(
  opposites_fit_A,
  . ~ . - (time | id) + us(time + 0 | id),
  dispformula = ~ 0
)

summary(opposites_fit_C)
#>  Family: gaussian  ( identity )
#> Formula:          opposites_naming_score ~ time + I(baseline_cognitive_score -  
#>     mucog) + (us(time + 0 | id)) + time:I(baseline_cognitive_score -  
#>     mucog)
#> Dispersion:                              ~0
#> Data: opposites_naming
#> 
#>           AIC           BIC        logLik      deviance      df.resid 
#>  5.013983e+12  5.013983e+12 -2.506992e+12  5.013983e+12           139 
#> 
#> Random effects:
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>  Groups Name Variance Std.Dev.
#>  id     time 9.985    3.16    
#> Number of obs: 140, groups:  id, 35
#> 
#> Conditional model:
#>                                            Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)
#> (Intercept)                               1.644e+02  1.726e-05 9521576   <2e-16
#> time                                      2.696e+01  5.341e-01      50   <2e-16
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)      -1.136e-01  1.402e-06  -80993   <2e-16
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)  4.329e-01  4.338e-02      10   <2e-16
#>                                             
#> (Intercept)                              ***
#> time                                     ***
#> I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog)      ***
#> time:I(baseline_cognitive_score - mucog) ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
